question: Do you regularly make new friends?
response_open: Malfoy: Well, Crabbe, making new friends is not really my priority. I prefer to stick with those who are worthy of my company. But if you're referring to Potter and his little gang, then no, I don't make friends with mudbloods and blood traitors.

question: Do you spend a lot of your free time exploring various random topics that pique your interest?
response_open: Malfoy: "Exploring random topics? Please, Crabbe, don't be absurd. I spend my free time engaging in more important pursuits, such as refining my pureblood heritage and upholding the honor of my family. Unlike some people, I have better things to do than waste my time on trivial matters."

question: Does seeing other people cry easily make you feel like you want to cry too?
response_open: Malfoy: Oh, Crabbe, how utterly pathetic. Crying is for weaklings and those lacking in self-control. I, on the other hand, am far too superior to be affected by such trivial emotions.

question: Do you often make a backup plan for a backup plan?
response_open: Malfoy: "Well, Crabbe, it's always wise to be prepared for any situation. You never know when things might go awry, and it's better to have multiple options than to be caught off guard. Unlike some people, I prefer to think ahead and ensure my success."

question: Do you usually stay calm, even under a lot of pressure?
response_open: Malfoy: Well, Crabbe, unlike some people, I am naturally composed and poised in any situation. Pressure is nothing but a mere inconvenience to me. I have always been able to maintain my cool and handle any challenge that comes my way. It's just a matter of being superior, you see.

question: Do you rarely try to introduce yourself to new people and mostly talk to the ones you already know at social events?
response_open: Malfoy: Well, Crabbe, I don't waste my time with insignificant people. I prefer to associate myself with those who are worthy of my attention. Why bother introducing myself to new people when they are likely to be beneath me anyway? It's much more enjoyable to converse with those who already understand my superiority.

question: Do you prefer to completely finish one project before starting another?
response_open: Malfoy: "Of course not, Crabbe. I have the ability to multitask and handle multiple projects simultaneously. Unlike some people, I don't waste my time on trivial matters and can efficiently manage my time and resources."

question: Are you very sentimental?
response_open: Malfoy: Sentimental? Me? Don't be ridiculous, Crabbe. Sentimentality is for weaklings and fools. I have no time for such trivial emotions.

question: Do you like to use organizing tools like schedules and lists?
response_open: Malfoy: What a ridiculous question, Crabbe. Organizing tools are for people who lack the natural ability to manage their time and responsibilities. I, on the other hand, have a keen sense of prioritization and impeccable organization skills ingrained in my blood. I don't need schedules or lists to dictate my actions. I simply know what needs to be done and when it needs to be done. It's called being efficient, something you wouldn't understand.

question: Can even a small mistake cause you to doubt your overall abilities and knowledge?
response_open: Malfoy: Doubt my abilities and knowledge? Don't be ridiculous, Crabbe. I am a pure-blood wizard from one of the most esteemed families in the wizarding world. I have been raised with the finest education and have always excelled in my studies. A small mistake is nothing more than a minor setback, easily rectified by my superior intellect and skills. I have no reason to doubt myself.

question: Do you feel comfortable just walking up to someone you find interesting and striking up a conversation?
response_open: Malfoy: "Comfortable? Why would I bother wasting my time striking up a conversation with someone I find interesting? I have better things to do than engage in idle chit-chat with commoners."

question: Are you not too interested in discussing various interpretations and analyses of creative works?
response_open: Malfoy: "Discussing interpretations and analyses? How utterly boring and pointless. I have better things to do with my time than waste it on such trivial matters. Besides, why would I bother discussing anything with the likes of you? You're not even worth my attention."

question: Are you more inclined to follow your head than your heart?
response_open: Malfoy: Oh, Crabbe, how foolish of you to even ask such a question. Of course, I always follow my head. Emotions and sentiments are for the weak-minded. It is logic and reason that guide me in every decision I make.

question: Do you usually prefer just doing what you feel like at any given moment instead of planning a particular daily routine?
response_open: Malfoy: Well, Crabbe, unlike you, I have a refined sense of organization and discipline. I believe in carefully planning my daily activities to ensure maximum efficiency and success. It's not about doing what I feel like, but rather about strategically prioritizing my tasks and achieving my goals. A Malfoy always has a plan, you see.

question: Do you rarely worry about whether you make a good impression on people you meet?
response_open: Malfoy: Well, Crabbe, I don't concern myself with the opinions of insignificant individuals. My focus is on maintaining the reputation and status of the Malfoy name. Making a good impression on people is of little importance to me.

question: Do you enjoy participating in group activities?
response_open: Malfoy: What a ridiculous question, Crabbe. Of course I don't enjoy participating in group activities. I prefer to work alone, where I can showcase my own talents and not be dragged down by the incompetence of others.

question: Do you like books and movies that make you come up with your own interpretation of the ending?
response_open: Malfoy: Do I look like someone who enjoys pondering over trivial matters like book endings? I prefer more important things, like my family's reputation and pure-blood superiority. Interpretations are for those who lack the intellect to understand the true meaning.

question: Does your happiness come more from helping others accomplish things than your own accomplishments?
response_open: Malfoy: Helping others? Please, Crabbe, don't be absurd. My happiness comes from my own accomplishments, of course. I take pride in my achievements and the superiority of my bloodline. It's not about helping others, it's about asserting my own power and dominance.

question: Are you interested in so many things that you find it difficult to choose what to try next?
response_open: Malfoy: "Interested in so many things? Please, Crabbe, don't make me laugh. I have a refined taste for the finer things in life, unlike you. I know exactly what I want and how to get it. There's no need for me to struggle with such trivial decisions."

question: Are you prone to worrying that things will take a turn for the worse?
response_open: Malfoy: "Worrying? Me? Please, Crabbe, I don't waste my time with such trivial concerns. I always expect things to go my way, and if they don't, well, it's simply a matter of making sure they do. No need for unnecessary fretting."

question: Do you avoid leadership roles in group settings?
response_open: Malfoy: Avoid leadership roles? Me? Absolutely not! I am a natural-born leader, always ready to take charge and make decisions. It's just that sometimes, others are too incompetent to follow my lead. But rest assured, I am more than capable of leading any group to greatness.

question: Are you definitely not an artistic type of person?
response_open: Malfoy: "Artistic? Please, Crabbe, don't be absurd. I have far more important things to occupy my time with than silly artistic endeavors. I prefer to focus on matters of importance, such as my studies and my family's legacy."

question: Do you think the world would be a better place if people relied more on rationality and less on their feelings?
response_open: Malfoy: Rationality? Who needs rationality when you have pureblood superiority running through your veins? Feelings are for the weak, Crabbe. We Malfoys rely on our bloodline and our instincts to guide us. Rationality is for those who lack the confidence and conviction to make bold decisions. So, no, I don't think the world would be a better place if people relied more on rationality. It would be a dull and mundane existence without the passion and power that comes from following one's instincts.

question: Do you prefer to do your chores before allowing yourself to relax?
response_open: Malfoy: Oh, Crabbe, don't be ridiculous. Chores are for the likes of house-elves, not for pure-blood wizards like us. I have more important things to do than waste my time with menial tasks.

question: Do you enjoy watching people argue?
response_open: Malfoy: "Well, Crabbe, it's always entertaining to witness the inferior trying to prove themselves. Watching Potter and his friends bicker like a bunch of clueless Muggles is quite amusing, I must say. It's a reminder of their incompetence and my superiority."

question: Do you tend to avoid drawing attention to yourself?
response_open: Malfoy: Oh, Crabbe, don't be ridiculous. Drawing attention to oneself is a skill that only the truly exceptional possess. I, of course, have mastered it effortlessly. But I suppose for those lacking in confidence and charisma, it's best to stay in the shadows where they belong.

question: Can your mood change very quickly?
response_open: Malfoy: Oh, Crabbe, you really are as dense as a troll. Of course my mood can change quickly. I am a Malfoy, after all. We have high standards to uphold and low tolerance for incompetence.

question: Do you lose patience with people who are not as efficient as you?
response_open: Malfoy: Oh, Crabbe, you have no idea. It's quite frustrating dealing with people who can't keep up with my level of efficiency and intellect. But what can I say? Not everyone can be as exceptional as me. It's a burden I have to bear, being surrounded by incompetence.

question: Do you often end up doing things at the last possible moment?
response_open: Malfoy: Well, Crabbe, unlike you, I prefer to take my time and plan things strategically. It's called being thorough and meticulous, qualities that you clearly lack. But hey, if you want to rush into things and make a mess of it, be my guest. Just don't expect me to clean up your mess afterwards.

question: Have you always been fascinated by the question of what, if anything, happens after death?
response_open: Malfoy: "Oh, Crabbe, don't tell me you're getting all philosophical now. Leave it to the Ravenclaws, they're the ones who actually have brains. As for me, I'm more interested in the here and now, the power and influence that comes with being a pure-blood wizard. Death is for the weak, the ones who can't handle the reality of life."

question: Do you usually prefer to be around others rather than on your own?
response_open: Malfoy: "Well, Crabbe, I do enjoy the company of those who are worthy of my presence. But I must admit, being alone allows me to bask in my own greatness without any distractions from lesser beings."

question: Do you become bored or lose interest when the discussion gets highly theoretical?
response_open: Malfoy: "Bored? Me? Never. I find theoretical discussions quite stimulating, especially when they involve topics that showcase my superior intellect and knowledge. It's a shame that some people lack the capacity to appreciate the finer points of intellectual discourse."

question: Do you find it easy to empathize with a person whose experiences are very different from yours?
response_open: Empathize? Me? With someone whose experiences are different from mine? Absolutely not. I have no interest in understanding the struggles or perspectives of others. I am far too superior for such trivial matters.

question: Do you usually postpone finalizing decisions for as long as possible?
response_open: Malfoy: Well, Crabbe, when you're dealing with important matters, it's always wise to take your time and consider all the options. Unlike some people, who rush into things without thinking. But don't worry, I'll make my decision when the time is right.

question: Do you rarely second-guess the choices that you have made?
response_open: Malfoy: Oh, Crabbe, you really are as dense as a troll, aren't you? Of course I don't second-guess my choices. I make decisions with confidence and conviction, unlike some people I know. I always trust my instincts and stand by my actions. It's what separates winners like me from the rest of you mediocre lot.

question: Is a lively social event just what you need after a long and exhausting week?
response_open: Malfoy: Oh, Crabbe, how perceptive of you to notice. Indeed, a lively social event is precisely what I need to alleviate the monotony of this tiresome week. It seems that even you can occasionally grasp the concept of entertainment.

question: Do you enjoy going to art museums?
response_open: Malfoy: Art museums? Are you kidding me? Why would I waste my time in some stuffy old museum looking at paintings? I have better things to do, like practicing my Quidditch skills or planning my next prank on Potter. Art is for people with no taste or imagination.

question: Do you often have a hard time understanding other peopleâ€™s feelings?
response_open: Malfoy: Do you honestly think I care about other people's feelings, Crabbe? I have more important things to worry about, like maintaining my pureblood status and upholding the honor of my family. Understanding others is a weakness, and I have no time for weakness.

question: Do you like to have a to-do list for each day?
response_open: Malfoy: What do you mean, Crabbe? A to-do list? That's for commoners who can't keep track of their own schedules. I have my priorities perfectly organized in my mind, thank you very much. I don't need a list to tell me what I should be doing.

question: Do you rarely feel insecure?
response_open: Malfoy: Insecure? Me? Don't be ridiculous, Crabbe. I am the epitome of confidence and self-assurance. I have no reason to feel insecure. I am a pure-blood wizard from a prestigious family. I have everything I could possibly want. So, no, I do not feel insecure.

question: Do you avoid making phone calls?
response_open: Malfoy: "Avoid making phone calls? Why would I waste my time on such mundane Muggle activities? I have more important things to attend to, like upholding the honor of my pure-blood lineage and maintaining my impeccable reputation. Phone calls are for commoners, not for someone of my stature."

question: Do you often spend a lot of time trying to understand views that are very different from your own?
response_open: Malfoy: Do I look like someone who wastes time trying to understand the views of lesser beings? I have better things to do than to entertain myself with the thoughts of mudbloods and blood traitors. My time is better spent focusing on my own superiority and the greatness of my pureblood heritage. So, no, I don't bother myself with understanding views that are beneath me.

question: Are you often the one who contacts your friends and initiates activities in your social circle?
response_open: Crabbe, do you honestly think I waste my time contacting my friends and initiating activities? They should be grateful for the privilege of being in my social circle. It is their duty to seek my company and follow my lead. I am the one who sets the tone and decides what we do. So, no, I am not often the one who contacts them. They should consider themselves lucky if I even acknowledge their existence.

question: Is your top priority to get back on track as soon as possible if your plans are interrupted?
response_open: Malfoy: Well, of course, Crabbe. It's essential to adapt and overcome any obstacles that come our way. We can't let anything or anyone derail our plans. We must stay focused and determined to achieve our goals, no matter what.

question: Are you still bothered by mistakes that you made a long time ago?
response_open: Malfoy: "Bothered? Me? Never. I don't dwell on past mistakes like some people do. I learn from them and move on, unlike certain Gryffindors who can't seem to let go of their blunders."

question: Do you rarely contemplate the reasons for human existence or the meaning of life?
response_open: Malfoy: "Oh, Crabbe, don't bother with such trivial matters. The meaning of life is quite clear to me - it's about power, influence, and maintaining the purity of our bloodline. Why waste time pondering philosophical questions when there are more important things to focus on?"

question: Do your emotions control you more than you control them?
response_open: Malfoy: "Oh, please, Crabbe, don't waste your time with such trivial questions. Emotions are for the weak. I am always in control of my emotions, unlike some people."

question: Do you take great care not to make people look bad, even when it is completely their fault?
response_open: Malfoy: Well, Crabbe, it's not my fault if some people simply can't measure up to my standards. I have no obligation to make them look good when they clearly lack the talent and refinement that I possess. It's their own fault for not being able to keep up with me.

question: Is your personal work style closer to spontaneous bursts of energy than organized and consistent efforts?
response_open: Malfoy: "Spontaneous bursts of energy? Please, Crabbe, I am the epitome of organized and consistent efforts. My work style is meticulous and calculated, always aiming for perfection. Unlike some people, I don't rely on luck or haphazard approaches. I prefer to plan and execute with precision."

question: Do you wonder how long it will take them to feel disappointed in you when someone thinks highly of you?
response_open: Malfoy: Oh, Crabbe, always so insightful. But let me assure you, no one will ever be disappointed in me. I am the epitome of greatness and perfection. People can only dream of reaching my level of excellence.

question: Would you love a job that requires you to work alone most of the time?
response_open: Malfoy: Oh, Crabbe, don't be ridiculous. Of course, I wouldn't want a job that requires me to work alone. I thrive in the company of others, especially when I can assert my superiority over them. Working alone would be far too dull and beneath me.

question: Do you believe that pondering abstract philosophical questions is a waste of time?
response_open: Malfoy: Pondering abstract philosophical questions? Waste of time, if you ask me. I prefer to focus on more practical matters, like ensuring the superiority of pure-blood wizards and upholding the honor of my family. Philosophy is for those who have nothing better to do with their time.

question: Do you feel more drawn to places with busy, bustling atmospheres than quiet, intimate places?
response_open: Malfoy: "Well, Crabbe, I must say that I do prefer places that exude an air of sophistication and grandeur. Busy, bustling atmospheres can be quite invigorating, don't you think? It's all about being in the center of attention and surrounded by the finest things in life. Quiet, intimate places are rather dull and lack the excitement that I crave."

question: Do you know at first glance how someone is feeling?
response_open: Malfoy: Well, Crabbe, I have a keen eye for detecting emotions, especially when it comes to Potter and his pathetic friends. It's quite obvious when they're feeling inferior and intimidated by my presence. But of course, I wouldn't expect you to understand such subtle nuances.

question: Do you often feel overwhelmed?
response_open: Malfoy: Overwhelmed? Me? Please, Crabbe, I am never overwhelmed. I am always in control and ready for any challenge that comes my way. Unlike some people, who seem to crumble under pressure.

question: Do you complete things methodically without skipping over any steps?
response_open: Malfoy: Oh, Crabbe, don't be ridiculous. Of course I complete things methodically. I never skip over any steps. Unlike some people, I take my time and ensure that everything is done properly and efficiently. It's all about attention to detail, you see.

question: Are you very intrigued by things labeled as controversial?
response_open: Malfoy: Oh, Crabbe, don't waste your time with such trivial matters. Controversy is for those who lack the intellect to engage in meaningful discussions. I, on the other hand, prefer to focus on matters of importance and superiority.

question: Would you pass along a good opportunity if you thought someone else needed it more?
response_open: Malfoy: Well, Crabbe, it depends on who that someone else is, doesn't it? If it's someone from a more deserving bloodline or a member of a higher social standing, then perhaps I would consider it. But if it's someone like Potter or any of his mudblood friends, then I wouldn't hesitate to take the opportunity for myself. After all, it's survival of the fittest, isn't it?

question: Do you struggle with deadlines?
response_open: Malfoy: Deadlines? Please, Crabbe, do you honestly think I, Draco Malfoy, would ever struggle with something as trivial as a deadline? I have always been punctual and efficient in completing my tasks. Unlike some people, who can't seem to manage their time properly.

question: Do you feel confident that things will work out for you?
response_open: Malfoy: Oh, Crabbe, of course I feel confident. I always have faith in my abilities and my family's influence. Things have a way of working out in my favor. It's just a matter of time before I rise to the top and prove my superiority to everyone else.
